title: Communication and Speech Emergence (CaSE) Research Collaboratory
text:
This is a Quarto website.

1 + 1

[1] 2


Welcome to the Communication and Speech Emergence Research Collaboratory (CaSE Lab) webpage!
The research of the CaSE Lab, based at Case Western Reserve University (CWRU) in Cleveland, Ohio, focuses on the early identification and intervention of speech and communication support needs for infants and young children with motor-based neurodevelopmental disabilities, particularly cerebral palsy (CP).
Our goal is to optimize evaluation and treatment methods for speech-language pathologists (SLPs) to improve clinical support planning for these children and their families and ultimately enhance their long-term quality of life.
Dr. Helen Long, PhD, CCC-SLP directs the CaSE Lab and partners alongside students at CWRU, clinicians, famillies, local disability and translational research groups, and a range of community members to support young children with or at risk for disabilities. View Dr. Long’s webpage here.
